subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: The L.P.G.A. Corning Classic, the longest-running event on the women’s tour with the same title sponsor and played at the same venue, in Corning, N.Y., since its inception in 1979, will end in May. Jack Benjamin, the tournament president, said Monday that the board of directors came to the conclusion after six months of discussion. The tournament had an option for 2010, but Benjamin said the loss of more than $500,000 in sponsorship revenue made it unfeasible to sustain it beyond this year in the economic climate.
